patient_info: Abnormality of refraction,Visual loss,Cafe-au-lait spot,Cranial hyperostosis,Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins,Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia,Abnormal shape of the occiput
golden_diagnosis: McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic
predict_diagnosis:
1. Neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1)
2. Osteogenesis imperfecta type 1 (OI1) with fibrous dysplasia
3. McCune-Albright syndrome
4. Melanotic Xanthogranuloma (MXG)
5. Lisch nodular corneal dystrophy
6. Cherubism
7. Hyperophic osteoarthropathy
8. Jaffe-Campanacci syndrome
9. SAPHO syndrome (Synovitis, Acne, Pustulosis, Hyperostosis, and Osteitis)
10. Gorham-Stout disease (GSD)

Each of these conditions can present with a combination of the clinical features described in the patient's phenotype, such as cranial hyperostosis, cafe-au-lait spots, fibrous dysplasia, and visual abnormalities. However, a precise diagnosis would require a comprehensive clinical evaluation, including detailed family history, physical examination, imaging studies, and possibly genetic testing.
